metadata.title: CVE-2022-41861 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in freeradius. A malicious RADIUS client or home server can send a malformed abinary attribute which can cause the server to crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41861` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeradius - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-common - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-config - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-dhcp - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-iodbc - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-krb5 - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-ldap - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-memcached - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-mysql - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-postgresql - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-python3 - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-redis - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-rest - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-utils - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
freeradius-yubikey - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
libfreeradius3 - 3.2.0+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeradius package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.0+dfsg-1').
